diyar 0.0.1.9000

    • Implementing case definitions for epidemiological analysis in R

  • Changelog

Change the returned outputs of diyar functions from data.frames to S4 objects, and vice versa

to_s4.Rd

Convert the returned output of record_group, episode_group, fixed_episodes and rolling_episodes from the current default (data.frame) to pid or epid objects, and vice versa.

to_s4(df)

to_df(s4)

Arguments

df

data.frame. Returned output of record_group, episode_group, fixed_episodes and rolling_episodes
s4

pid or epid objects

Value

to_s4 - pid or epid objects

to_df - data.frame object

Examples

data(infections)
dates <- infections$date
output <- fixed_episodes(dates, case_length=30)
#> Episode or recurrence window 1.
#> 6 of 11 record(s) grouped into episodes. 5 records not yet grouped.
#> Episode or recurrence window 2.
#> 5 of 5 record(s) grouped into episodes. 0 records not yet grouped.
#> 
#> Episode grouping complete - 0 record(s) assinged a unique ID. 
output
#>    sn epid   case_nm
#> 1   1    1      Case
#> 2   2    1 Duplicate
#> 3   3    1 Duplicate
#> 4   4    1 Duplicate
#> 5   5    1 Duplicate
#> 6   6    1 Duplicate
#> 7   7    7      Case
#> 8   8    7 Duplicate
#> 9   9    7 Duplicate
#> 10 10    7 Duplicate
#> 11 11    7 Duplicate

# from a data.frame to pid/epid object
output_2 <- to_s4(output)
output_2
#>  [1] "E-1 (C)" "E-1 (D)" "E-1 (D)" "E-1 (D)" "E-1 (D)" "E-1 (D)" "E-7 (C)"
#>  [8] "E-7 (D)" "E-7 (D)" "E-7 (D)" "E-7 (D)"

# from the a pid/epid object to a data.frame
output_3 <- to_df(output_2)
output_3
#>    epid sn   case_nm
#> 1     1  1      Case
#> 2     1  2 Duplicate
#> 3     1  3 Duplicate
#> 4     1  4 Duplicate
#> 5     1  5 Duplicate
#> 6     1  6 Duplicate
#> 7     7  7      Case
#> 8     7  8 Duplicate
#> 9     7  9 Duplicate
#> 10    7 10 Duplicate
#> 11    7 11 Duplicate
